title: ¾ Teaspoon: How to Measure Baking Soda, Salt & More

steps.title: Scoop the ingredient with both a 1/2 teaspoon and a 1/4 teaspoon.
steps.content: Scoop the ingredient with both a 1 / 2 teaspoon and a 1 / 4 teaspoon . Grab the 1 / 2 teaspoon and 1 / 4 teaspoon from your regular set of measuring spoons; together, they’ll create a 3 / 4 teaspoon in total. Simply scoop up and level off your ingredients in each spoon and add them to the rest of your mixture. https://mysweetprecision.com/how-to-measure-3-4-teaspoon/

steps.title: Use a 1/4 teaspoon 3 times to get 3/4 total.
steps.content: Use a 1 / 4 teaspoon 3 times to get 3 / 4 total. Grab your trusty 1 / 4 teaspoon and scoop up the first portion of your ingredient. https://mysweetprecision.com/how-to-measure-3-4-teaspoon/ Simply repeat this process 2 more times, and you’ll have a 3 / 4 tsp in total added to your recipe!

steps.title: Fill up a regular teaspoon so it’s three-quarters of the way full.
steps.content: Fill up a regular teaspoon so it’s three-quarters of the way full. A 3 / 4 teaspoon is 75% of a single teaspoon—with this in mind, fill up a traditional teaspoon about three-quarters of the way with the required ingredient. You can also fill up the teaspoon completely and then scoop a little bit off the top.

steps.title: Buy a 3/4 teaspoon.
steps.content: Buy a 3 / 4 teaspoon . Smaller measuring spoon sets only come with 4-6 spoons (like 1 / 8 tsp, 1 / 4 tsp, 1 / 2 tsp, 1 tsp, 1 / 2 tbsp, and 1 tbsp), while larger teaspoon sets come with a 3 / 4 tsp as well. Feel free to buy a single 3 / 4 teaspoon if you already have other measuring spoons at home, or upgrade your kitchen with a full set. Adjustable measuring spoons are another great option—with this tool, you use a movable tab and printed lines to make a customized measuring spoon.

steps.title: Approximate a 3/4 tsp by adding the ingredient in pinches.
steps.content: Approximate a 3 / 4 tsp by adding the ingredient in pinches. The average “pinch” of a dry ingredient ranges between 1 / 16 tsp and 1 / 8 tsp. If your pinches are pretty small, add up to 12 pinches of the required ingredient. If your pinches are on the larger side, use closer to 6 pinches in your recipe.

steps.title: Use a kitchen scale if you’d like to be extra accurate.
steps.content: Use a kitchen scale if you’d like to be extra accurate.
